title: LANDS END ORB / lands end shot viscal
description: the conclusion dialogue where you conclude the shot did not come from land's end. this fires only if you have  TASK.check_lands_end

dialogueTree.title: Visual Calculus: "Is there something here that would..."
dialogueTree.text: Is there something here that would indicate a sniper used this place as a nest for taking the shot? Just some urban detritus, a bottle and a dilapidated old comms tower.

links.title: Endurance: "The wind picks up. Fine sea foam la..."
links.text: The wind picks up. Fine sea foam lashes your face. It feels like needles. You can take it -- just raise your collar, detective.

links.title: Perception: "In the distance you can hear the br..."
links.text: In the distance you can hear the breakers roar.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I don't see it, officer. I don't s..."
links.text: "I don't see it, officer. I don't see a person take a shot here and hit something there..." He looks east, over the coast. "In the Whirling-in-Rags."

links.title: You: "Maybe the campfire was used by the..."
links.text: Maybe the campfire was used by the perpetrator?

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""To warm his hands before pulling t..."
links.text: "To warm his hands before pulling the trigger? Perhaps. But anyone could have made this. The coast is specked with fires this time of year." He looks around.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Truthfully -- this seems like a ve..."
links.text: "Truthfully -- this seems like a very poor choice to take a 1.2 kilometre rifle shot from. Visibility is awful, there's water vapour everywhere -- I think we can rule out... B double prime, was it?"

links.title: Visual Calculus: "To warm his hands before he pulled..."
links.text: To warm his hands before he pulled the trigger? There are no markings on the ground for a tripod, he would have had to lie on a mattress. This is simply not a good spot for a 1.2 kilometre shot.

links.title: You: "Maybe the assailant climbed the com..."
links.text: Maybe the assailant climbed the comms tower, took the shot there?

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""It's not possible to climb that la..."
links.text: "It's not possible to climb that ladder and even if it were -- why? There's no platform up there to aim from." The lieutenant looks up, raising his collar.

links.title: Endurance: "He looks like he's cold out here at..."
links.text: He looks like he's cold out here at the tip of the coast. The jacket is warm, but not for this weather.

links.title: You: ""Kim, you look cold -- maybe a thic..."
links.text: "Kim, you look cold -- maybe a thicker coat?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I'm okay. You on the other hand --..."
links.text: "I'm okay. You on the other hand -- look like you're about to turn into a popsicle."

links.title: Rhetoric: "Technically speaking that would be..."
links.text: Technically speaking that would be a...

links.title: You: ""Copsicle. You meant to say copsicl..."
links.text: "Copsicle. You meant to say copsicle."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""No. I did not. We *Seolites* don't..."
links.text: "No. I did not. We *Seolites* don't do paranomastic humour."

links.title: You: ""It's my style. Superstar cops don'..."
links.text: "It's my style. Superstar cops don't wear parkas. They rock out."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Absolute idiocy," he nods in ackno..."
links.text: "Absolute idiocy," he nods in acknowledgement of the idiocy on display.

links.title: You: ""What if I *want* to be a popsicle?""
links.text: "What if I *want* to be a popsicle?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Don't be silly, no one wants to be..."
links.text: "Don't be silly, no one wants to be a popsicle."

links.title: You: ""You're right. I should look into t..."
links.text: "You're right. I should look into this situation before I die of hypothermia."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""That seems smart, yes.""
links.text: "That seems smart, yes."

links.title: You: ""Kim, you look cold -- maybe a litt..."
links.text: "Kim, you look cold -- maybe a little pilot cap?

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""No.""
links.text: "No."

links.title: Rhetoric: "No what?"
links.text: No what?

links.title: You: ""No what -- you're not cold?""
links.text: "No what -- you're not cold?"
"No, an orange pilot cap would not help." He turns to face the sea.
"No what -- an orange pilot cap would not help?"
"Yes, that one. No to the orange pilot cap." He turns to face the sea.

links.title: Rhetoric: "How do you respond to a pithy *no*..."
links.text: How do you respond to a pithy *no* like that? He's just *not* into pilot caps, it seems.

links.title: Visual Calculus: "The salty water has corroded the la..."
links.text: The salty water has corroded the ladder to nothing but two thin orange rails. In addition, there is no stable nest up there. It would have been useless.

links.title: Savoir Faire: "It does look *extremely* rickety. A..."
links.text: It does look *extremely* rickety. And wouldn't help much either.

links.title: You: "What about the cigarette butts?"
links.text: What about the cigarette butts?

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Those?" He points to them. "A smok..."
links.text: "Those?" He points to them. "A smoking assailant who favours Tioumoutiri to Astra or Drouin? Cigarette butts are everywhere. This is a common brand for old men."

links.title: Encyclopedia: "Tioumoutiri was a Revacholian colon..."
links.text: Tioumoutiri was a Revacholian colony on Iilmaraa. The suzerainty's population was mostly Iilmaraan Areopagites -- up to 97%. The region was known for its tobacco export. Hence the name.

links.title: You: "I want to know *a lot* more about t..."
links.text: I want to know *a lot* more about this.

links.title: Encyclopedia: "Oh, you do! The butts you saw had a..."
links.text: Oh, you do! The butts you saw had a silhouette of a boy wearing a kofia hat -- a tobacco picker. This boy is the Tioumoutiri brand logo. Contemporary Revacholians prefer Drouin (a local blend from the southern islands) or Astra, a legendary cigarette from Graad. Tioumoutiri is favoured by older men who like its old fashioned paper filter tips, insane amount of tar and the sweet smells of colonialism and halva.

links.title: You: "Enough. The cigarettes are unimport..."
links.text: Enough. The cigarettes are unimportant.

links.title: Encyclopedia: "Nothing is unimportant, detective."
links.text: Nothing is unimportant, detective.

links.title: Inland Empire: "Still, you felt it was important en..."
links.text: Still, you felt it was important enough to make a mental note. That means *something*. You didn't pay attention to any of the other cigarette butts on the coast.

links.title: Visual Calculus: "A smoking assailant who favours Tio..."
links.text: A smoking assailant who favours Tioumoutiri to Astra or Drouin? Cigarette butts are part of the campfire set -- they're also everywhere.

links.title: You: "Look over the water -- to the Whirl..."
links.text: Look over the water -- to the Whirling-in-Rags.

links.title: Visual Calculus: "There, 1.2 kilometres over the wave..."
links.text: There, 1.2 kilometres over the wave-crossed bay, through heavy, dark grey curtains of rain you see the smallest rectangle, barely visible.

links.title: Visual Calculus: "The light is off on the third floor..."
links.text: The light is off on the third floor of the Whirling-in-Rags. The young woman is gone, in Precinct 57. Safe, closed off. Her form no longer moves behind the glass there...

links.title: Visual Calculus: "The light is off on the third floor..."
links.text: The light is off on the third floor of the Whirling-in-Rags. The young woman is gone who knows where. Safe, closed off. Her form no longer moves behind the glass there...

links.title: Visual Calculus: "It's glowing in the dark night. The..."
links.text: It's glowing in the dark night. The lights are on. Klaasje must be in there... looks like she's kept her promise not to go out at night anymore.

links.title: Electrochemistry: "Such a good girl, you think."
links.text: Such a good girl, you think.

links.title: Visual Calculus: "It's late. There is no light on the..."
links.text: It's late. There is no light on the third floor of the Whirling-in-Rags. No shape moves behind it. Klaasje must be out on the town.

links.title: Visual Calculus: "A glowing light on the third floor..."
links.text: A glowing light on the third floor of the Whirling-in-Rags. With binoculars you would see a young woman's shape move behind the glass, her limbs long and slender.

links.title: Electrochemistry: "Smoking. Drinking. Being happy and..."
links.text: Smoking. Drinking. Being happy and elated. Without you -- because you're here, freezing in the wind, aren't you? Doing your *detective work*.

links.title: Visual Calculus: "There, 1.2 kilometres over the cold..."
links.text: There, 1.2 kilometres over the cold water of the bay, through a thick snowstorm melting flake by flake in the waves you see the smallest rectangle, barely visible.

links.title: Visual Calculus: "There, 1.2 kilometres over the cold..."
links.text: There, 1.2 kilometres over the cold water of the bay, blue from the distance and the air, you see the smallest rectangle, barely visible.

links.title: You: "[Finish thought.]"
links.text: [Finish thought.]

links.title: Visual Calculus: "Are you sure? You haven't ruled out..."
links.text: Are you sure? You haven't ruled out the shot coming from here yet...

links.title: You: "I said finish the god damn thought...."
links.text: I said finish the god damn thought.[Leave.]

links.title: You: "Oh right..."
links.text: Oh right...

links.title: Visual Calculus: "So?"
links.text: So?
